title: Operations Standard â€“ Quality Assurance
purpose: Define enforceable quality gates for CORE, including test coverage, autonomous remediation, audit exception handling, and change evaluation.

rules.statement: Production code MUST maintain a minimum of 55% test coverage.
The system SHOULD converge toward a target test coverage of 80% or higher.
Critical code paths MUST meet elevated coverage thresholds as defined by policy.
Code changes MUST NOT reduce overall coverage below the minimum threshold without an approved remediation plan.
Coverage calculations MUST exclude non-executable or non-critical paths.
If coverage drops below the minimum threshold, autonomous test remediation MUST be triggered.
Autonomous remediation MUST trigger when predefined degradation signals are detected.
Autonomous remediation MUST execute in defined phases: analysis followed by test generation.
Any audit exception MUST be explicitly declared with scope and justification.
The default state for audit exceptions MUST be empty.
All changes MUST be evaluated using the weighted quality evaluation framework.
Changes MUST achieve a minimum evaluation score of 0.7 to be accepted.
Changes scoring between 0.5 and 0.7 SHOULD be flagged for human review.
Medium-risk changes MUST pass checkpoint and canary validation with a minimum score of 0.80.
High-risk changes MUST pass checkpoint, canary validation, and approver quorum with a minimum score of 0.90.
An explicit intent MUST be declared prior to applying a change.
All changes MUST include an explanation or justification.
Post-change quality verification MUST be performed and recorded.
Medium and high-risk changes MUST record quorum evidence.
